content: I decided I needed to change my desktop background this morning as they can get boring quickly when you see the same one for months on end. I actually found it difficult to find many images at 2560x1600 as alot of the sites I would normally use didn't allow searching by resolution or just made it difficult to do. In my quest for high resolution desktop backgrounds I have saved these various places that will take you directly to search results pages chock full of wallpapers at 2560x1600 pixels. http://interfacelift.com/wallpaper_beta/downloads/date/widescreen/2560x1600/ http://www.flickr.com/search/?q=2560x1600&m=tags&ct=5&mt=photos http://www.pulsarmedia.ro/search.html?search_fields=all&search_keywords=2560x1600&search_terms=any http://myhdwallpaper.com/v/2560x1600Wallpapers/ http://wallpaperstock.net/wallpapers_2560x1600r.html http://images.google.co.uk/images?q=2560x1600+wallpapers&hl=en&imgsz=huge http://www.wallcoo.net/2560x1600/index.htm I decided to go with this New York cityscape in the end :) Edit on 10/05/2009: I've found the exact place where the new york photo was taken. It's at 40"45'36.41 N 73"59'27.36 W Elevation 57m. Great if you want to have a look on Google Earth.
title: 2560x1600 Desktop Backgrounds
name: 2560x1600-desktop-backgrounds

comments.author: Craig Mayhew
comments.comment: Ive just uploaded the kmz file which will allow you to download the exact location where the New York cityscape was taken. Its available here and will only work if you have Google Earth installed.
comments.browser: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-GB; rv:1.9.0.10) Gecko/2009042513 Ubuntu/8.04 (hardy) Firefox/3.0.10

comments.author: Andy
comments.browser: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10.5; en-US; rv:1.9.0.8) Gecko/2009032608 Firefox/3.0.8 GTB7.0

comments.author: Craig Mayhew
comments.comment: Also, just discovered that bing has added a "Wallpaper" image size to it's image search engine. This automatically detects your screen resolution and returns only images that perfectly match the resolution.
comments.browser: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.3) Gecko/20100423 Ubuntu/10.04 (lucid) Firefox/3.6.3
